clean_content:
Definition / general

* Associated with lymphadenopathy during course of disease in 82%, usually axillary ([J Int Med Res 2003;31:345](12964513))* Lymphadenopathy usually disappears during disease remission* May also have fever, weight loss, anemia* Modestly increased risk of lymphoma, may be due to methotrexate treatment

Microscopic (histologic) description

* Follicular hyperplasia with sparse ([J Clin Pathol 1990;43:106](2318986)) vs. active ([Acta Pathol Jpn 1990;40:249](1695414)) proliferative activity, interfollicular plasma cells with Russell bodies, vascular proliferation* Capsular lymphocytic infiltrate* May resemble plasma cell variant of Castleman disease* Often PAS+ extracellular hyaline material* Occasionally focal necrosis and microabscesses* May have sarcoid-like granulomas

Microscopic (histologic) images

AFIP images  

[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/afip06_61.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/afip06_61.jpg)

Reactive lymphadenopathy of rheumatoid arthritis

  
  
Images hosted on other servers:  

[![Missing Image](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/lymphnodesrheumatoidarthritisthumbimg01.jpg)](http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC501828/figure/F1/)

Follicular hyperplasia  
with eosinophilic  
material in  
interfollicular areas

[![Missing Image](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/lymphnodesrheumatoidarthritisthumbimg02.jpg)](http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC501828/figure/F2/)

Extensive replacement  
by focally calcified  
eosinophilic material

[![Missing Image](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/lymphnodesrheumatoidarthritisthumbimg03.jpg)](http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC502289/figure/F1/)

Rounded, well  
separated follicles  
with expanded  
paracortex

[![Missing Image](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/lymphnodesrheumatoidarthritisthumbimg04.jpg)](http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC502289/figure/F2/)

Follicular center composed  
primarily of centrocytes,  
with no / rare tingible body  
macrophages or mitotic figures

[![Missing Image](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/lymphnodesrheumatoidarthritisthumbimg05.jpg)](http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC502289/figure/F4/)

Interdigitating dendritic  
cells (CD1+) are associated  
with small lymphocytes

Negative stains

* Polyclonal plasma cells (no light chain restriction)
